waves.text: The failed experiments on immortality research triggered a rain that turns everyone who touches it into zombies.
Luckily I was at home today, but my wife and children haven't returned since this morning, hopefully they survived somehow...
Now I have no choice but to defend myself.
The morning brought a grim realization: my supplies are dwindling.
I scavenged through nearby buildings, dodging the ever-lurking undead.
Today I checked my supplies. 6 cans of beans, 20 litres of water and 1 chocolate bar.
That should be enough for an entire week, but I need to come up with a plan for next week, the zombies only become more and more...
It feels so weird to be alone in this house, every time I look at the pictures of my family the chances of them surviving becomes lower and lower.
I would want to go out and look for them but it is just to dangerous.
Today it was a bit quieter, maybe the zombies understood that I will not let them in by any chance.
Bonk Bonk - Wait what's that? There is someone at my door! What should I do?
It's a dog! Must be one of our neighbors and he looks healthy. I let him in. That must mean animals are immune to the virus.
He will be a good compagnion in this big and lonely house. I'll call him Timmy.
I decided to ignore the knocking, I can't risk my life for a stranger.
It stopped after a while, I hope whatever it was outside is gone now and won't try to break into my house.
